answers.author: Matthew McQuillen
answers.text:
Anthony, I would recommend Lyle Sumek.  I have worked with him in two communities (recent past and current).  He has a lot of experience and was in City Management early in his career.  He facilitates strategic planning for many cities across the country, from California, Florida, Texas, Georgia, Iowa and Illinois.  He has a commanding presence and does a good job of controlling the meeting and does not let certain elected officials dominate the conversation.  Just google Sumek & Associates.

answers.author: Cheryl Hilvert
answers.text:
Hi Anthony!  I wanted to let you know that the Commonwealth Centers for High Performance Organizations offer a strategic planning product.  CCHPO is a preferred provider of the Center for Management Strategies, specializing in a variety of tools to assist organizations in improving their performance.  The Center is promoting high performance organization strategies as a leading practice, and, as such, trying to let local government managers know about the concepts through education and technical assistance through the Center.   In addition to the high performance strategies, CCHPO offers some "essential skill" training/services, including strategic planning.  It is conducted by an associate of CCHPO that has extensive local government experience as well as a proven track record of working with managers and their city councils in this type of work.  You can learn more on the Center for Management Strategies website at icma.org/managementstrategies under the HPO tab or you can contact me directly at chilvert@icma.org.
